triples.name: Sliding mode control
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel sliding mode control law with guaranteed reachability for fuzzy networked singularly perturbed systems.

triples.name: Fuzzy logic
triples.relevance: The paper uses Takagi-Sugeno fuzzy systems to model the networked control system.

triples.name: Singular perturbation
triples.relevance: The paper addresses singularly perturbed systems where a small parameter affects the system's highest derivative.

triples.name: Networked control system
triples.relevance: The paper tackles the control problem for systems where control and feedback signals are exchanged through a communication network.

triples.name: State observer
triples.relevance: The paper uses an observer-based technique to estimate internal system states from measurement outputs.

triples.name: Quantization (signal processing)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes the use of a logarithmic quantizer to process measurement output and reduce communication burden.

triples.name: Lyapunov stability
triples.relevance: The paper uses Lyapunov methods to guarantee asymptotic stability of the sliding mode dynamics and error system.

triples.name: H-infinity methods in control theory
triples.relevance: The paper develops sufficient conditions to guarantee H-infinity performance for the control system.

triples.name: Discrete time and continuous time
triples.relevance: The paper addresses discrete-time Takagi-Sugeno fuzzy networked singularly perturbed systems.
